uk.ac.uea.framework.implementation

Class AndroidGraphics

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.uea.framework.implementation.AndroidGraphics
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Graphics

    public class AndroidGraphics
extends java.lang.Object
implements Graphics
    Class that allows the display of graphics on a canvas, including drawn images and image files (.png, .jpg, etc.)

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface uk.ac.uea.framework.Graphics

        Graphics.ImageFormat

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) AssetManager assets
      Object that stores the assets for the graphics implementation
      (package private) Canvas canvas
      Canvas object that creates and stores the graphics canvas to which things can be drawn
      (package private) Rect dstRect 
      (package private) Bitmap frameBuffer
      Bitmap object that stores the complete frame to be displayed, from the memory buffer.
      (package private) Paint paint
      Paint object that holds the colour and style information for drawing objects
      (package private) Rect srcRect 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AndroidGraphics(AssetManager assets, Bitmap frameBuffer)
      Constructor that loads in the assets and framebuffer for displaying images in bitmap format, then creates a canvas and paint context.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clearScreen(int color)
      Clears the current screen and resets it to a new colour value
      void drawARGB(int a, int r, int g, int b)
      Converts given colour information into an ARGB format that includes an alpha-channel
      void drawImage(Image Image, int x, int y)
      Overloaded method that draws an image on the canvas given an Image object and co-ordinates of the top-left of the frame
      void drawImage(Image Image, int x, int y, int srcX, int srcY, int srcWidth, int srcHeight)
      Draws an image on the canvas given an Image object and a frame in which to draw it
      void drawLine(int x, int y, int x2, int y2, int color)
      Draws a line on the canvas, from (x, y) to (x2, y2)
      void drawRect(int x, int y, int width, int height, int color)
      Draws a rectangular shape on the canvas
      void drawScaledImage(Image Image, int x, int y, int width, int height, int srcX, int srcY, int srcWidth, int srcHeight)
      Draws a scaled version of the image on the canvas, given the parameters of the original and the new image to be drawn
      void drawString(java.lang.String text, int x, int y, Paint paint)
      Draws an image of inputted text parsed as a String object to the canvas
      int getHeight()
      Returns the height of the canvas via the frame buffer's info on one frame
      int getWidth()
      Returns the width of the canvas via the frame buffer's info one one frame
      Image newImage(java.lang.String fileName, Graphics.ImageFormat format)
      Creates a new image object in a format that can be drawn to the canvas

    • Field Detail

      • assets

        AssetManager assets
        Object that stores the assets for the graphics implementation

      • frameBuffer

        Bitmap frameBuffer
        Bitmap object that stores the complete frame to be displayed, from the memory buffer. Designed more around game implementations, fitting in with the intention of the legacy code

      • canvas

        Canvas canvas
        Canvas object that creates and stores the graphics canvas to which things can be drawn

      • paint

        Paint paint
        Paint object that holds the colour and style information for drawing objects

      • srcRect

        Rect srcRect

      • dstRect

        Rect dstRect

      • AndroidGraphics

               Bitmap frameBuffer)
        Constructor that loads in the assets and framebuffer for displaying images in bitmap format, then creates a canvas and paint context.

        assets - Assets to be loaded in
        frameBuffer - Framebuffer object to store the frame

        drawImage in interface Graphics
        Parameters:

        x - horizontal co-ordinate of the point in the top-left of the frame
        y - vertical co-ordinate of the point in the top-left of the frame
        srcX - horizontal starting point of the top-left of the source image
        srcY - vertical starting point of the top-left of the source image
        srcWidth - width of the source image
        srcHeight - height of the source image

      • drawScaledImage

        public void drawScaledImage(Image Image,
                   int x,
                   int y,
                   int width,
                   int height,
                   int srcX,
                   int srcY,
                   int srcWidth,
                   int srcHeight)
        Draws a scaled version of the image on the canvas, given the parameters of the original and the new image to be drawn
        Parameters:
        Image - Image to be drawn and scaled
        x - New X co-ordinate
        y - New Y co-ordinate
        width - New width
        height - New height
        srcX - Original X co-ordiante
        srcY - Original Y co-ordinate
        srcWidth - Source width
        srcHeight - Source height
